content.description: Start on edges around 5ft and go left hand to a sidepull. fall into the razor thin vertical crimp thingy and make a biggish move to the lip. exit up and slightly right.
content.location: inside the main dark heart area opposite of the ventral fin

content.description: Sit start on a sloper and crimp. Climb the overhanging arete and face.
content.location: To the left of Dark Angel.

content.description: This problem beings low (no lower) on the "holster" pocket and another jug.  Start crossed and move through the jugs until you get to an undercling.  Reach out left to an ok pocket and bicycle.  THe crux is the next two moves establishing on the next thin finger lock pocket and then reaching up to a crimp work your feet to a good foot out left and reach a juggy pocket.  Cross left hand to the next crimp then cross back underneath your left hand to an undercling jug.  Slap up to the lip and bump until you can get a left heel hook on the lip and (red point crux) surge out to a good right hand crimp.  Rock over.  3 stars for awesome holds, movement and obvious line, -1 star for the slab at your back which is annoying more than anything.
content.protection: Two or three pads and a spotter.  There is a slab that follows closely behind you as you climb so a thin pad would be best as there is a high dab-potential.
content.location: From the Dragon's Den head along the ridge about 100 yards past Satan, Satan, Satan and Kim with a Bathtub in her Head.  The boulder rests downhill off the ridge by itself.

content.description:
An amazing highball with a good landing. 

  Start out by moving up past the right edge of the large scoop feature. Then head left across the scoop aiming for the sloping ramp that leads up to a white jug, crux. From the jug a huge move gains the obvious flake and another big move to the lip. Beware of loose rock over the lip when topping out.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. There is a rock to the left of the landing area that might be an issue though I've heard that people don't actually hit it.
content.location: As you approach the Dark Heart from the Dragons Den you first come to Backdoor Man. Head past this problem and The Tall Cool Red One is the next tall obvious face you come to.

content.description:
Arete and compression climbing on perfect rock.  More about finesse than power. 

  Start on double underclings and lunge to a sloper.  Bump your left hand up the arete and make a hard move to a sidepull on the face.  Shuffle up the arete some more, go to another sidepull.  Move your feet out right, cross over to a sloper, match, and fire for the lip. 

  The last 3 moves are the hardest.  Would get 4 stars if it wasn't so close to other boulders. 

  The PG13 comes from the eerily close wall behind you when you toss for the top.  No one ever hit it, but it feels like you could.
content.protection: Bring at least 3 pads and one spotter.  More is better.
content.location: Left end of the Dark Heart.

content.description: Standing start from the lower left on a small rail. Traverse right and up on decent holds to a cool, balancy mantle to a crimp. Make another move or two to the rollover lip and some friable holds. Use a bit of caution topping out. Walk off left.
content.location: As you enter the Dark Heart cavern coming from Backdoor Man this is the first problem on the right.

content.description: Start on juggy crimps and follow a set of crimps til a throw move out left.  Match and punch to the arete again for the delicate top out.  4 stars for excellent holds, movement, obvious line and landing.
content.protection: Two pads and a spotter for the crux move.
content.location: This route is in the back room when you are in the Dark Heart proper.

content.description:
Start on the great left facing flake under the large roof. Make a large move out to a good hold and try to keep your feet on the wall, or cut them and keep them off the ground. From here throw left hand to a slopy pocket and work the core tension to bring your right hand up to a good crimp.  From here traverse straight right crossing your left hand into a good pocket.  Now figure out how to obtain and match the miserable crimp directly right.   Once matched move right to a good sidepull and stand up to an undercling.  Finish up the easy slab. 

  Originally rated V11 but if I could do it then it's not V11, so grade is my guess. 

  Named after the Large Juniper that's in the area.  That Juniper tree is the oldest living thing in the park.
content.location: Located above the Dark Heart chamber area. Near the large Juniper walk up on of the boulders to a small corridor. If you're looking at "Something Different" this would be above and to the right.

content.description: Start on holds around head height and move straight up the crimpy face.
content.location: In the center of the Dark Heart room. The obvious crimpy face climb. Same boulder as Something Different. Good solo route

climbs.name: Kim with a Bathtub in Her Head

content.description: Starts low on sharp crimps. Move upward on more sharp crimps to a big lockoff move to the top.
content.location: South of the Dragon's Den. Note: Hueco Tanks State Park placed a soft closure on this bouldering area, effective February 9th, 2017.

content.description:
This problem starts on the shared underclings of Le Chnickel but moves right traversing a ways until you get to an interesting lip encounter that has multiple solutions. 

  Beta:  (if I can remember right).  Start matched on the underclings and get a funky right kneebar.  Reach out left hand to a crimp and then get a right foot heel/toe cam.  Cross to the pinch left hand and drop your right hand down to a sloper that will allow you to readjust your left hand to change the thumb-catch on the pinch.  Step left foot on the crimp you just used for your right hand and surge out to the arete.  Swing feet over.  From here there are multiple sequences that involve (1) doing a high tension move to allow you to match your left hand to the arete and reach up to the jug, (2) bumping blindly all the way to the jug (that's what I did) or potentially even (3) going feet first and toehooking the jug blindly and then matching it to top out.  3 stars for cool holds, unique movement and beta and decent landing, -1 star for an indirect line and PG-13 for the potential landing in the yucca doing the redpoint crux.
content.protection: Two pads.  A spotter to keep you off the yucca.
content.location: From the main trail that leads up to the Dark Heart, after passing Ultramega take the trail up and left staying close to the cliffside.  There is a small passage that you go through and take your immediate right and you'll see the yucca plant of which I speak.

content.description:
Weird press/mantle thingy to a seam and chossy top out or chimney. 

  Start from a jug rail and move up and left on a sloper. Figure out how to get up to the seam 8 feet above you. Once in the seam work up that to the top. At this point you will be below a cap stone and the holds moving right out from under it are choss, however the opposite wall of the corridor is right behind you. What you do is up to you.
content.location: On your right as you enter the dark heart on the sweet looking wall. Start in the middle of the wall and work left and up to the seam.

climbs.name: Jamocha Joe aka Purple Bunny Fuckers

content.description:
Start on the great left facing flake under the large roof.  Make a large move out to a good hold and try to keep your feet on the wall, or cut them and keep them off the ground.  From here turn left and make a big move to a slopy pocket.  Get a good undercling, and cross into a horizontal seam.  Work this slightly left and make a big throw to a huge jug.  Match here and drop off or continue up the chossy squeeze chimney and walk around through on the kitty litter ledge. 

  Name and Grade are both guesses as this is a fairly new problem, and I couldn't find it on Nick's scorecard.
content.location: Located above the Dark Heart chamber area.  Near the large Juniper walk up on of the boulders to a small corridor.  If you're looking at "Something Different" this would be above and to the right.

content.description:
The crux is near the middle and the landing is flat. 

  Climb edges and sidepulls up the right side of the blunt arete until you can move around to the left onto the main wall at an angling shelf. Paddle your feet on terrible holds and thrutch up and left to the next shelf. Get yourself organized and continue along the improving shelf to the top at Dark Angel.
content.location: In the Dark Heart proper on the uphill wall. Problem starts to the right of the blunt arete at the right edge of the wall. Climbs up and traverses left across the middle of the wall to top out at the top of Dark Angel.

content.description: Stand start with decent holds on either side of the arete. Move up the arete to an easier top. Probably easy for the grade.
content.location: The arete directly opposite of Ventral Fin. There is a small boulder right behind this arete you might want a spot for.

content.description: Climb the crack in a corner. You can jam straight in, layback or stem. The crack is almost all hand sized for those with average sized mitts.
content.location: In the Dark Heart proper. On the left side of the uphill wall in the corner.

content.description: Start on the high right facing flake and climb up on great holds to the top.  The first moves are the hardest, but the top gets quite high.
content.protection: Probably best not to fall from high up, but the landing zone is flat, so with enough pads and spotters this might be able to be done safely.
content.location: On the opposite side of the boulder from Le Chninkel and Julio and Me.  Up the hill from Ultramega.

content.description: A shady room that offers the classics Dark Heart and Something Different.  Only holds the standard ten person tour.
